response: "{ \"title\": \"Easy: Divisible by Two\", \"description\": \"Write a function `is_divisible_by_two` that checks if a given integer is divisible by 2. The function should return `True` if the input integer is divisible by 2, and `False` otherwise.\\n\\n#### Function Signature\\n```python\\ndef is_divisible_by_two(n: int) -> bool:\\n```\\n\\n#### Input\\n- `n` (int): An integer that may be positive or negative.\\n\\n#### Output\\n- Returns `True` if the input integer is divisible by 2, `False` otherwise.\\n\", \"code\": \"def is_divisible_by_two(n: int) -> bool:\\n    return n % 2 == 0\\n\", \"tests\": [\"assert is_divisible_by_two(10) == True\", \"assert is_divisible_by_two(-4) == True\", \"assert is_divisible_by_two(3) == False\", \"assert is_divisible_by_two(100000) == True\"] }"
